name: Boise, ID
tagline: Outdoor paradise with excellent safety and affordability—but Idaho politics and very low diversity are dealbreakers

cost_of_living.index_vs_national: Near national average (rising but still reasonable)

diversity.summary: ⚠️ CRITICAL CONCERN: Boise is 82% White, less than 2% Black. This is Idaho—one of the whitest states in the nation. While Boise proper is more liberal and welcoming than rural Idaho (Democratic mayor, Pride parades), state politics are deeply conservative Republican. An interracial couple would be highly visible. Candace would face isolation as one of very few Black residents. The outdoor/tech transplant community is progressive, but this is not a diverse city by any measure.
diversity.notable: Idaho passed anti-transgender laws, abortion bans; state legislature is extremely conservative despite Boise being moderate

safety.summary: Excellent safety—one of the safest mid-sized cities in America. Violent crime rate is 247 per 100k (33% lower than national average). Property crime also below national average. Boise ranks in 64th percentile for safety. Most neighborhoods feel very safe. This would easily meet Candace's San Diego safety baseline—likely exceed it.

scenery.summary: Stunning mountain and high desert scenery. Boise sits at the base of the Boise Foothills with immediate access to hiking, mountain biking, skiing (Bogus Basin 16 miles). Boise River Greenbelt (25-mile paved path) runs through city. Dramatic sunsets, sagebrush desert meets pine forests. Less lush than Pacific Northwest but expansive Western beauty.

climate.summary: Four true seasons with dry, sunny weather. Hot summers (90s) but low humidity makes it bearable. Cold winters with real snow (20 inches annually) but sunny—over 200 days of sun per year. Much drier than Seattle, warmer winters than Denver. High desert climate—big temperature swings day to night.

culture.summary: Boise has evolved from conservative Western town to outdoor-focused progressive enclave (within Idaho). Growing food scene, craft breweries, Basque heritage (largest Basque population outside Spain), farmers markets, Treefort Music Fest. Outdoor recreation is the dominant culture—hiking, biking, skiing, rafting. Tech industry growing (Micron, startups). However, conservative state politics loom large.

pros: Extremely safe—exceeds Candace's San Diego baseline
Excellent outdoor recreation access (hiking, skiing, river)
Affordable with strong job market (tech, healthcare)
Boise Greenbelt is incredible—25 miles of paved riverside trail
200+ sunny days, dry climate, four seasons
Small-city charm with growing food/culture scene
Downtown is improving, walkable core emerging
Friendly, outdoorsy community (if you fit the demographic)
cons: ⚠️ DEALBREAKER: Less than 2% Black population—Candace would face severe isolation
Idaho state politics are extremely conservative (abortion bans, anti-LGBT laws)
Interracial couple would be highly visible—acceptance varies person-to-person
Very white, homogeneous culture outside progressive transplant bubble
Limited cultural diversity—food scene, arts are growing but small
Growing fast—housing costs rising, infrastructure strained
Cold winters with real snow (though sunny)

neighborhoods.name: North End
neighborhoods.vibe: Boise's historic, tree-lined neighborhood—charming bungalows, walkable, progressive
neighborhoods.diversity_notes: Most liberal/progressive part of Boise, but still very white
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Best bet for diversity/acceptance within Boise. Walkable, near trails, character homes. Still overwhelmingly white but most open-minded.

neighborhoods.name: Downtown Boise
neighborhoods.vibe: Urban core—walkable, restaurants, arts, urban living
neighborhoods.diversity_notes: Most diverse part of Boise (still not very diverse), younger crowd
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Most walkable. Near everything. Urban energy (Boise-scale). Access to Greenbelt. Best option if you're determined to try Boise.

neighborhoods.name: East End / Hyde Park
neighborhoods.vibe: Artsy, eclectic neighborhood with Hyde Park village feel
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Bohemian vibe Josh would appreciate. Safe, near foothills for hiking. Neighborhood shops and cafes. Charming but small.

neighborhoods.name: Boise Bench (Central Rim / Morris Hill)
neighborhoods.vibe: Residential neighborhoods with parks, family-friendly, affordable
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Affordable, safe, some walkability. Access to parks and Greenbelt. More residential/suburban feel. Practical but less character.

neighborhoods.name: Southeast Boise
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Not recommended—too suburban, car-dependent, homogeneous. Prioritize North End or Downtown if considering Boise at all.
